recipes.title: Cabbage Soup
recipes.description: Hearty beef and cabbage soup with Heinz 57 sauce.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients in 3 quart Dutch oven.
Cook on medium-low heat until cabbage is tender.

assumptions: Inferred 1 for meat tenderizers or seasoned salt (standard quantity)
Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Carrot Soup
recipes.description: Simple curried carrot soup - quick and flavorful.

instructions.text: Bring broth to boil.
Add vegetables and curry powder.
Cook until carrots are almost soft (about 5 minutes).
Serve. Garnish with fresh parsley, mint, or chives, chopped.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese Meatball Soup
recipes.description: Hearty vegetable soup with homemade meatballs and Cheez Whiz.

instructions.text: Mix meatball ingredients together. Shape into medium size balls.
Place uncooked meatballs and all ingredients, except Cheez Whiz in large saucepan.
Stir gently. Bring mixture to a boil. Cover and simmer on low till vegetables are tender.
Before serving, add Cheez Whiz and stir gently until blended.

notes: Crock Pot Method: Place meatballs and all ingredients, except Cheez Whiz, in slow cooker. Stir gently. Cover and cook on LOW setting. Add Cheez Whiz before serving.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Spicy Minestrone
recipes.description: Hearty Italian vegetable soup with hamburger, beans, zucchini, and pasta.

ingredients.prep_note: cut in quarters lengthwise, then sliced

instructions.text: Brown hamburger, onion, and garlic in Dutch oven. Drain all but 1 tablespoon fat.
Add potatoes and bell pepper; cook 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes with their liquid, herbs, spices, and pepper flakes, beef stock, salt, and pepper to taste.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.
Stir in kidney beans with their liquid, zucchini, and pasta. Simmer until pasta is tender, about 20 minutes.
Add salt and pepper if needed. Pass cheese with the soup and let guests help themselves.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Steak Soup
recipes.description: Hearty slow-cooker beef and vegetable soup thickened with a roux.

instructions.text: Cook, covered, on LOW for 8 to 10 hours.
One hour before serving time, turn on HIGH.
Mix together 1/2 cup flour and 1/2 cup oleo, melted, until smooth.
Add to crock pot. Cook until thickened.

notes: Cook in Crock Pot

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Hot Sausage Soup
recipes.description: Hearty sausage soup with potatoes, corn, beans, and cabbage.

instructions.text: Saute sausage and onions. Add potatoes and enough water to cover.
Cook till tender.
Add corn, beans, juice, and cabbage. Cook till cabbage is done.
More juice can be added if desired.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for whole kernel corn
Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for kidney beans
Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Jacob's Pottage
recipes.description: Authentic Biblical-style lentil and rice stew - as food Esau bought!

ingredients.item: large dry onions (or leeks with green stalks)

instructions.text: Soak lentils and rice in large soup kettle for several hours. Keep water 1 inch above mixture.
When ready to cook, saute chopped onions in oil.
Add to boiling lentil-rice mixture. Add bouillon.
Cook until rice is soft. Serve thick, hot or cold.
Drop into pita/pocket bread.

notes: Biblical recipe - what Esau traded his birthright for

recipes.title: Potato-Cheese Soup
recipes.description: Creamy pureed potato soup with sharp cheddar cheese.

ingredients.prep_note: peeled and cut into 1/2 inch cubes (2 cups)

instructions.text: In large saucepan, place potatoes, water, carrot, celery, bouillon, and pepper.
Over medium-high heat, bring to a boil; reduce heat to low.
Cover and simmer for 25 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
Place 1/2 in a blender container or food processor bowl; cover. Blend or process until smooth.
Return to saucepan. Add cheese. Cook and stir over medium heat until cheese melts.
To serve, sprinkle with parsley.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: French Onion Soup (Quick)
recipes.description: Quick French onion soup using frozen onions and canned broth.

instructions.text: Empty package of frozen onions into saucepan and heat until they brown lightly. (Do not add butter - as they thaw they brown in their own water.)
Add to onions 1 can bouillon and 1 can consomme. Do not dilute soup.
Heat mixture until blended; remove and let cool. If made ahead of time, refrigerate until ready to serve.
Toast 2 slices of bread and cut into halves.
Pour soup mixture into 4 ovenproof bowls. Add 1/2 slice toast.
Over toast, sprinkle Swiss cheese. Top with American.
Place soup bowls under broiler about 5 minutes, or until brown.
Remove and serve.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: French Onion Soup
recipes.description: Classic French onion soup with deeply caramelized onions and Gruyere cheese.

instructions.text: In Dutch oven, heat butter and oil over medium heat. Add onions, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper; stir.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until onions begin to soften, about 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to low and cook slowly, stirring occasionally, until onions are caramelized, about 1 hour and 15 minutes.
After 30 minutes, the onions should be light golden brown, 30 to 45 minutes later, onions should be a deep brown.
Stir flour into onions; bring to a bubble. Cook 2 to 3 minutes.
Slowly stir in broth, water, and brandy. Simmer, partially covered, about 15 minutes.
Add salt and pepper if needed. Heat oven to 325°F.
Cut bread into 4 thick slices. Place on baking sheet and bake until dry, about 6 minutes per side.
Pour soup into heatproof bowls. Put a piece of bread on top of each and mount cheese on bread.
Place in broiler until golden brown (2 to 3 minutes).

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Hamburger Soup
recipes.description: Easy hamburger and vegetable soup with macaroni.

instructions.text: Brown and drain ground beef.
Add dry ingredients. Stir in water, sauce, celery, and carrots.
Cover and cook on low for 2 hours.
Cook macaroni. Add to soup.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and serve.

recipes.title: Cream of Broccoli Soup
recipes.description: Creamy pureed broccoli and cauliflower soup.

instructions.text: Puree broccoli and cauliflower.
Melt margarine in medium saucepan; saute onions until soft.
Add flour, stirring constantly. Add broth, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Bring to a boil; add pureed vegetables.
Reduce heat and gradually stir in milk.
Heat thoroughly, but do not boil.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cod Chowder
recipes.description: New England-style fish chowder with cod, bacon, and clam juice.

instructions.text: Rinse fish with cold water; pat dry with paper towels. Cut fish into 1/2 inch cubes; set aside.
In a small skillet, saute bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet; blot with paper towels and crumble; set aside.
Discard all but 2 tablespoons bacon drippings from skillet. Add onion to skillet; saute until tender but not brown. Remove from heat.
In deep saucepan, combine onion and potatoes. Add water, cover, and bring to gentle boil; reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add fish; cover and bring to boil again. Reduce heat and cook for additional 10 minutes, or until fish and potatoes are done.
In small bowl, combine flour and clam juice; stir with fork until smooth.
Add to fish and potato mixture, stirring constantly to blend flour. Stir in evaporated milk, butter, salt, and white pepper.
Continue heating over medium heat until chowder thickens.
Garnish with crumbled bacon before serving.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cold Strawberry Soup
recipes.description: A sweet, refreshing cold soup perfect for summer - more like a dessert!

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, stirring well.
Transfer half to a container of an electric blender and process until almost smooth.
Repeat procedure with remaining mixture. Serve immediately.

notes: May use vanilla ice cream in place of strawberry

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Seafood Stew
recipes.source_note: MomMom's cookbook, page 46 - printed community cookbook
recipes.description: A hearty stew with salt pork, potatoes, shrimp, and whitefish in a tomato base.

instructions.text: In a large saucepot, cook salt pork until crisp. Remove pork and reserve.
Add onion, green pepper, and celery and saute about 5 minutes.
Add reserved pork, potatoes, tomatoes, and seasonings.
Cover and simmer 45 minutes.
Add shrimp, fish, and scallops and simmer 10 minutes longer.

recipes.title: Pasta Fagiola
recipes.description: Traditional Italian bean and pasta soup.

instructions.text: Sort and wash beans. Place bean in a large Dutch oven and cover with water 2 inches above beans; soak for 24 hours.
Drain beans and return to Dutch oven.
Add water and next 11 ingredients; stir well. Bring to a boil; cover and reduce heat.
Simmer 1 hour and 35 minutes, or until beans are tender.
Remove and discard bay leaf.
Add macaroni and cook 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender.
Ladle soup into individual soup bowls. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for grated Parmesan cheese (standard quantity)
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Italian Chicken Soup
recipes.source_note: Newspaper/magazine clipping - incomplete, only beginning visible
recipes.description: Italian-style chicken soup.

instructions.text: [INCOMPLETE - instructions cut off from clipping]

notes: Recipe incomplete - only first few ingredients visible in clipping

flags: Recipe incomplete - most of recipe cut off from clipping

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Beef Stew
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Hearty classic beef stew with vegetables.

instructions.text: Place flour in a plastic bag. Add meat cubes, a few at a time, shaking to coat.
In a large saucepan or Dutch oven brown meat, half at a time, in hot oil. Return meat to saucepan. Add juice cocktail, onion, bouillon granules, garlic, basil, and thyme.

Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer 1 to 1 1/4 hours for beef (30 minutes for pork) or till meat is nearly tender. Add potatoes, carrots, and celery. Cover; simmer 30 minutes more. Skim fat. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

notes: Crockery-cooker directions: Prepare and brown meat as above. In the bottom of a 3 1/2- or 4-quart electric crockery cooker layer onion, potatoes, carrots, and celery. Sprinkle with bouillon granules, garlic, basil, and thyme; add meat. Pour 2 1/2 cups vegetable juice cocktail over meat. Cover; cook on low-heat setting for 10 to 12 hours or till meat and vegetables are tender.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Beef Broth
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Rich homemade beef broth from roasted soupbones.

ingredients.item: meaty beef soupbones (shank crosscuts, short ribs, or arm bones)

instructions.text: Place soupbones in a large shallow roasting pan. Bake in a 450° oven about 30 minutes or till well browned, turning once. Place soupbones in a large Dutch oven. Pour 1/2 cup water into the roasting pan, scraping up crusty browned bits. Add water mixture to Dutch oven. Add carrots, onions, celery, parsley, peppers, bay leaves, basil, garlic, 10 cups water, and 1 teaspoon salt.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 3 1/2 hours. Remove soupbones.

Pour broth through a large sieve or colander lined with 2 layers of cheesecloth. Discard vegetables and seasonings. If desired, clarify broth (see tip, below). If using the broth while hot, skim fat. (Or chill broth, then lift off fat.) If desired, when bones are cool enough to handle, remove meat from bones and reserve meat for another use. Discard bones.
Store broth and reserved meat, if any, in separate covered containers in the refrigerator up to 3 days or in the freezer up to 6 months. Makes about 8 cups broth.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Quick Vegetable-Beef Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Using ground beef and frozen vegetables yields soup in a jiffy.

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, left, or tip, opposite

instructions.text: In a large Dutch oven or kettle cook beef and onion till beef is brown and onion is tender. Drain fat.
Stir in beef broth, mixed vegetables, undrained tomatoes, potato, celery, marjoram, oregano, salt, pepper, and bay leaf.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or till vegetables are tender. Discard bay leaf. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

notes: EASY recipe tag in cookbook

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Chicken Broth
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For richer color, use an unpeeled yellow onion.
recipes.servings_yield: about 5 cups broth and 2 1/2 cups meat

ingredients.item: bony chicken pieces (backs, necks, and wings from 2 chickens)

instructions.text: In a large Dutch oven or kettle place chicken pieces, celery, carrots, onion, parsley, salt, thyme, sage, or basil, pepper, and bay leaves. Add water.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 2 hours. Remove chicken.

To strain, pour broth through a large sieve or colander lined with 2 layers of cheesecloth. Discard vegetables and seasonings. If desired, clarify broth (see tip, opposite). If using the broth while hot, skim fat. (Or chill broth, then lift off fat.) If desired, when bones are cool enough to handle, remove meat from bones and reserve meat for another use. Discard bones.
Store broth and reserved meat, if any, in separate covered containers in the refrigerator up to 3 days or in the freezer up to 6 months. Makes about 5 cups broth and 2 1/2 cups meat.

notes: Crockery-cooker directions: In a 3 1/2- or 4-quart electric crockery cooker combine chicken pieces, celery, carrots, onion, parsley, salt, thyme, sage, or basil, pepper, bay leaves, and 4 cups water. Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 8 to 10 hours. Remove chicken. Strain and store broth and meat as above.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Alphabet-Meatball Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fun soup for kids with tiny meatballs and alphabet pasta.

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, opposite, or tip, below

ingredients.item: alphabet pasta or other small pasta

ingredients.prep_note: coarsely chopped, or 1/2 of a 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, parsley, Parmesan cheese, garlic salt, and pepper. Add ground beef; mix well. Shape meat mixture into sixteen 1-inch balls.
In a medium saucepan combine beef broth, undrained beans, tomatoes, carrot, and Italian seasoning. Bring to boiling.
Drop meatballs, one at a time, into hot broth mixture. Add pasta. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes or till meatballs are no longer pink.
Stir in spinach and heat through. Season to taste. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

missing_inputs: Not in database: dried Italian seasoning

recipes.title: Chicken and Sausage Gumbo
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A roux adds color and flavor to many basic Cajun dishes like gumbo.

ingredients.item: andouille or smoked sausage, quartered lengthwise and sliced
sliced okra or frozen cut okra, thawed
whole large chicken breast, skinned, boned, and cut into bite-size pieces

instructions.text: For roux, in a large heavy saucepan or Dutch oven combine flour and oil till smooth. Cook over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to medium. Cook and stir about 15 minutes more or till roux is dark reddish brown.
Stir in onion, celery or green pepper, garlic, black pepper, and red pepper. Cook over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes or till vegetables are just crisp-tender, stirring often.

Gradually stir in hot chicken broth, andouille or smoked sausage, okra, and bay leaves. Add chicken. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer 20 to 30 minutes or till tender. Discard bay leaves. Serve over rice. If desired, garnish with a carrot top.

notes: Seafood Gumbo: Prepare as above, except substitute 12 ounces frozen shelled shrimp and 6 ounces fresh or frozen crabmeat for the chicken. Thaw shrimp and crab, if frozen. Cut up crab. Cook roux till light reddish brown. Add shrimp and crab during last 5 minutes of cooking.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Manhattan Clam Chowder
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A full-flavored tomato broth loaded with vegetables and clams.

instructions.text: Chop shucked clams, reserving juice; set aside. Strain clam juice to remove bits of shell. (Or, drain canned clams, reserving juice.) If necessary, add water to juice to equal 1 1/2 cups. Set aside.
In a large saucepan cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon, reserving drippings. Drain bacon on paper towels; crumble. Set aside.

Cook celery and onion in reserved bacon drippings over medium heat about 5 minutes or till tender. Drain. Stir in reserved clam juice, undrained tomatoes, potatoes, basil or marjoram, and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or till vegetables are tender.
With the back of a fork, slightly mash vegetables against side of pan. Stir in clams. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cook 1 to 2 minutes more. Sprinkle each serving with bacon.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Bean and Sausage Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: loose-pack frozen hash brown potatoes with onions and peppers
fully cooked Polish sausage or fully cooked smoked turkey sausage, halved lengthwise and sliced

instructions.text: In a large saucepan combine juice cocktail, undrained beans, potatoes, and sausage. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 10 minutes or till potatoes are tender and mixture is heated through. Sprinkle each serving with some of the cheese.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-quart casserole combine half of the vegetable juice and the potatoes. Micro-cook, covered, on 100% power (high) for 10 minutes or till potatoes are tender, stirring once. Add remaining vegetable juice, undrained beans, and sausage. Cook, uncovered, on high for 8 to 10 minutes or till heated through. Sprinkle each serving with some of the cheese.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Lentil Stew
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: This stew is a good choice when you're short on time because the lentils cook in just 35 minutes.

ingredients.item: fully cooked smoked sausage links, sliced

instructions.text: Rinse lentils; set aside. In a large saucepan cook leeks or onion and garlic in hot oil till tender but not brown. Stir in lentils, beef broth, undrained tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce, thyme or oregano, pepper, cumin, and bay leaf. Bring to boiling; reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.

Add carrot and celery. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes more or till lentils and vegetables are tender. Stir in sausage; heat through. Discard bay leaf. If desired, garnish each serving with snipped parsley.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Black Bean Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: fully cooked smoked turkey sausage or Polish sausage, chopped

instructions.text: Rinse beans. In a large saucepan combine beans and 6 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand for 1 hour. (Or, skip boiling the water and soak beans overnight in a covered pan.) Drain and rinse beans.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven cook onion, celery, and garlic in hot oil till tender. Add beans, chicken broth, coriander, salt, and red pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or till beans are tender.

If desired, mash beans slightly with a potato masher. Stir in sausage and, if desired, dry sherry. Cook 2 to 3 minutes more or till heated through. If desired, garnish with dairy sour cream, shredded Monterey Jack cheese, or snipped parsley.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Split Pea Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: smoked pork hocks or meaty ham bone

instructions.text: Rinse peas. In a large saucepan combine peas, broth, meat, marjoram, bay leaf, and dash pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 1 hour. Stir occasionally. Remove meat. When cool enough to handle, cut meat off bone and coarsely chop. Discard bone. Return meat to saucepan. Stir in carrot, celery, and onion. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 20 to 30 minutes or till vegetables are crisp-tender. Discard bay leaf.

recipes.title: Minestrone
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: small zucchini, halved lengthwise and sliced

instructions.text: Rinse beans. In a medium saucepan combine beans and 2 1/2 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand for 1 hour. (Or, skip boiling the water and soak beans overnight in a covered pan.) Drain and rinse beans.

In the same saucepan combine beans, 2 1/4 cups fresh water, carrot, celery, onion, bouillon granules, garlic, basil, oregano, and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 15 minutes. Drain; stir in half of one 15-ounce can great northern beans or one 8-ounce can red kidney beans. Add tomatoes, cabbage, zucchini, and spaghetti. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes more or till tender.

notes: Quick Minestrone: Prepare as above, except do not use dry great northern beans. In a large saucepan combine 2 1/4 cups water, carrot, celery, onion, bouillon granules, garlic, basil, oregano, and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 15 minutes. Drain; stir in half of one 15-ounce can great northern beans or one 8-ounce can red kidney beans. Add tomatoes, cabbage, zucchini, and spaghetti. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes more or till tender.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Tortellini-Vegetable Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Either frozen or dried tortellini works in this soup.

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan cook basil and garlic in hot oil about 1 minute. Add broth, tortellini, salt, and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Add tomatoes, green beans, and carrot. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes more or till tortellini is done and vegetables are tender. If desired, sprinkle each serving with Parmesan cheese.

notes: Note: If desired, substitute 2 tablespoons Pesto for Pasta for the basil, garlic, and oil. Stir in at the end of cooking.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Grated Parmesan cheese (optional) (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Wild Rice Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A sumptuous side dish with a nutty flavor.

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan combine broth and rice. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 45 to 50 minutes or till tender. Stir in onions and carrot during last 5 minutes of cooking. Combine cream or milk, flour, and pepper. Stir into rice mixture. Cook and stir till slightly thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. If desired, stir in sherry. Garnish with parsley or chives.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for Snipped parsley or chives

recipes.title: Wonton Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: small green pepper, cut into 1/2-inch pieces, or frozen pea pods, thawed and halved

instructions.text: Prepare wontons as directed, except do not fry. Freeze half of the wontons for another use.
In a saucepan bring 6 cups water to boiling. With a spoon, place wontons, one at a time, into boiling water. Reduce heat. Simmer for 5 minutes. Drain. Rinse with cool water; drain again.

In a saucepan combine chicken broth, carrot, and green pepper. (If using the pea pods, add to broth during the last minute of cooking.) Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 2 to 4 minutes or till vegetables are crisp-tender. To serve, divide wontons among bowls. Spoon broth mixture atop.

recipes.title: Cheese Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan combine chicken broth, carrot, celery, and onion. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 6 to 8 minutes or till vegetables are tender. Combine milk, flour, and pepper. Stir into broth mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Add cheese; stir till melted.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1 1/2-quart casserole combine 1/2 cup of the chicken broth, the carrot, celery, and onion. Micro-cook, covered, on 100% power (high) for 6 to 8 minutes or till vegetables are tender. Combine milk, flour, and pepper. Stir into broth mixture. Stir in remaining chicken broth. Cook, uncovered, on high for 8 to 10 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every 2 minutes till mixture starts to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Stir in cheese. Cook, uncovered, on high about 1 minute or till hot and cheese melts.
Beer Cheese Soup: Prepare as above, except reduce chicken broth to 1 cup. Stir 3/4 cup beer into soup with the cheese.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Corn Chowder
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: fresh medium ears of corn or frozen whole kernel corn

instructions.text: If using fresh corn, use a sharp knife to cut off just the kernel tips from the ears of corn, then scrape the cobs with the dull edge of the knife. (You should have 2 cups corn.)

In a large saucepan combine fresh or frozen corn, potato, onion, water, bouillon granules, and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 10 minutes or till corn and potatoes are just tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of the milk and the margarine or butter. Combine the remaining milk and flour. Stir milk-flour mixture into corn mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. If desired, garnish with snipped chives or snipped parsley and crisp-cooked, crumbled bacon.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cream of Vegetable Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine the cooked vegetable and 3/4 cup of the chicken broth. Cover and blend or process about 1 minute or till smooth. Set aside.

In a medium saucepan melt margarine. Stir in flour, seasonings, salt, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till slightly thickened and bubbly. Cook 1 minute more. Stir in vegetable mixture and remaining broth. Cook and stir till heated through. If necessary, stir in additional milk to make of desired consistency. Season to taste.

notes: Microwave directions: Blend or process the vegetable and chicken broth as above. Set aside. In a 1 1/2- or 2-quart casserole micro-cook margarine, uncovered, on 100% power (high) 30 to 60 seconds or till melted. Stir in flour, seasonings, salt, and pepper. Stir in milk all at once. Cook, uncovered, on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute till the sauce starts to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Stir in vegetable mixture and remaining broth. Cook, uncovered, on high 3 to 5 minutes more or till heated through, stirring once. If necessary, stir in additional milk to make of desired consistency.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Cooked vegetable (see chart)

instructions.text: Cook the bacon until crisp. Drain. Pour off all but 3 tablespoons of bacon drippings. Add the onion and potato and cook over medium heat, stirring, until the onion is lightly browned.
Add water, cover, and simmer until the potato is just tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
Add the corn, soup, mushrooms, milk, and salt. Heat to boiling, lower the heat, add the chiles, and simmer a few minutes.
Serve in soup bowls or a tureen. Crumble bacon on top.
Mix all the ingredients in a bowl and chill for 6 to 8 hours.
Serve with crackers or French bread.

recipes.title: Dock Soup
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian soup from The Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: A creamy soup made from young dock leaves.

instructions.text: Cook young leaves, drain off water and strain.
Add milk, onion, butter, and two tablespoons flour.
Cook slowly one-half hour.

recipes.title: Sorrel Soup
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: A rich, creamy soup from sheep sorrel leaves, high in vitamin C.

instructions.text: Chop sorrel and onion together (or ramps, if available).
Simmer in butter until wilted.
Add eggs and cream.
Bring to a quick boil and serve.

notes: Ramps can be substituted for onion if available

recipes.title: Nettle Soup
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian soup from The Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: A nutritious soup made from stinging nettles. Must gather with stout gloves!

ingredients.prep_note: gathered in early spring with gloves

instructions.text: Gather plants in early spring with stout gloves.
Cook a long time to destroy sting.
Add water, thicken with butter, flour, and egg yolks.

notes: Must gather with stout gloves
Repeated cookings destroy the sting

recipes.title: Milkweed Soup
recipes.source_note: Traditional wild food recipe from Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: Hearty soup made from milkweed shoots or young pods.

instructions.text: For shoots: Gather young shoots while young and tender (not after July). Wash, cook, and drain.
Add more water, rice, bacon drippings, salt, pepper, and wild onions.
Cook over a slow fire until done.
For pods: Boil a hambone in water.
Add young milkweed pods cut in small pieces, wild onions or ramps, and a handful of rice.
Cook slowly. Add salt and pepper before serving.

notes: Two methods: one using shoots, one using young pods. Only gather milkweed before July.

recipes.title: Appalachian Ramp Soup
recipes.description: Traditional soup made with wild ramps, with three variations using beef or venison.

instructions.text: Cut one pound of beef in small pieces, add salt and water, and boil.
Skim the foam from the top.
Add ramps, carrots, and potatoes cut in small pieces.
Take out meat and eat separately.
Put vegetables through sieve and serve hot.

notes: Variation 1: Cook beef or venison and add celery leaves, bay leaves, three cloves, and thirty-six ramps. Take meat out and serve separately. Lift out ramps and serve broth with rice.
Variation 2: Add fried ramps to beef stock. Season with black pepper and serve.

recipes.title: Mustard-Ramp Soup
recipes.description: Creamy soup made with wild mustard greens and ramps.

instructions.text: Clean and wash mustard leaves.
Heat one quart milk almost to boiling.
Meanwhile melt bacon fat in skillet, add chopped ramps, cook until brown.
Add salt, pepper, flour, and mustard. Cook five minutes.
Add milk and simmer.

recipes.title: Cream of Dandelion Soup
recipes.description: Creamy soup made with dandelion leaves, petals, and buds.

instructions.text: Gently boil dandelion leaves in 6 cups water. Pour off bitter water.
Boil gently a second time and drain.
In heavy-bottom soup pot, sauté leeks and garlic in butter until tender.
Add 4 cups water, dandelion leaves, flower petals, buds, and salt.
Simmer 45 minutes.
Add cream and simmer several minutes more. Garnish with flower petals.

recipes.title: Garlic Mustard Vichyssoise
recipes.description: Chilled potato soup with garlic mustard and goat cheese.

instructions.text: In a heavy bottomed pan add water and potatoes with salt and boil until potatoes soften. Set aside.
Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Add onion and cook until softened. Pour over boiled potatoes and water.
Blend in food processor until smooth. Add water as needed for consistency. Pass through a sieve.
Chill in refrigerator. Check seasoning.
Blanch garlic mustard for 10 seconds in salted boiling water and refresh in ice water.
Add garlic mustard and blend until smooth.
Add three cornered garlic and blend until smooth. Check seasoning.
Serve with crumbled goat's cheese, frothed milk, pinch of cumin, and white pepper.

recipes.title: Hungarian Cream of Chestnut Soup (Gesztenye Leves)
recipes.description: Rich Hungarian soup with chestnuts, ham, and cream.

ingredients.prep_note: peeled, cored, quartered and thinly sliced

instructions.text: Prepare chestnuts: Score fresh chestnuts with an X on the bottom. Boil in water 30 minutes, cool slightly, and peel. Chop finely once completely cooled.
Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add parsnips, carrots, apples, and leeks. Cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until nearly tender.
Mix in ham, chestnuts, and paprika. Cook one minute.
Add stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 20 minutes.
Whisk cream and egg yolks together. Temper by slowly adding hot soup broth while whisking.
Pour mixture back into soup, whisking constantly for one minute until thickened.
Season to taste. Serve with sour cream if desired.

recipes.title: Hawthorn Berry Soup
recipes.description: Sweet spiced soup from hawthorn berries.

instructions.text: Add berries to pot with water.
Simmer gently 30 minutes, covered.
Cool and pass through sieve (discard seeds).
Transfer to pan, add sugar, cinnamon, chili.
Cook until sauce thickens.
Serve.

notes: Do not eat the seeds

recipes.title: Bulrush Broth
recipes.description: Hearty broth with bulrush shoots, roots, and oxtail.

instructions.text: Roll meat in flour-salt mixture.
Sauté in hot fat until browned.
Add water, shoots, onions, cover, and simmer 1.5 hours until rice is tender.

recipes.title: Chaya Soup
recipes.description: Creamy soup made with chaya (tree spinach) leaves.

instructions.text: Place chopped chaya leaves, onions, and garlic in a pot with vegetable bouillon.
Cook 10 minutes on medium heat until leaves are blanched.
Add milk and allow to cool slightly.
Blend remaining ingredients until smooth, return to pot.
Heat 5-10 minutes until hot (do not boil).
Serve with cream drizzled on top and optional crushed dried red chili.

notes: Cook chaya for at least 10-20 minutes to eliminate hydrogen cyanide
Avoid aluminum cookware - use glass or pottery

recipes.title: Sea Lettuce Soup
recipes.description: Light Asian-style soup with sea lettuce (ulva) seaweed.

instructions.text: Bring stock to a boil.
Add sea lettuce and stir until soft.
Stir in beaten eggs and boil briefly, then remove from heat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add sesame oil, garnish with scallions, and serve.

notes: Wash sea lettuce well and optionally soak 2 hours before using

recipes.title: Garlic Mustard Vichyssoisse
recipes.description: A cold soup featuring foraged garlic mustard (jack-by-the-hedge) and three-cornered garlic.

instructions.text: In a heavy bottomed pan, add water and potatoes with a good pinch of salt. Boil until potatoes are soft. Remove from heat and set aside.
Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Add the onion and cook until softened. Pour over the boiled potatoes and water.
Blitz in food processor until smooth. Add water if needed to reach desired consistency. Pass through a sieve.
Chill in the refrigerator. Check seasoning.
Blanch jack-by-the-hedge for 10 seconds in salted boiling water and refresh in ice water.
Add jack-by-the-hedge and blitz again until smooth.
Add the three-cornered garlic, blitz until smooth, and check seasoning again.
Serve with crumbled goat's cheese, frothed milk, a pinch of cumin, crispy fried nettle dusted with white pepper, and a three-cornered garlic flower.

notes: Serve cold
Garlic mustard is also known as jack-by-the-hedge or sauce-alone

recipes.title: Bulrush Stew
recipes.description: A simple stew with bulrush roots and wild game.

instructions.text: Peel root skin and cut into inch-long pieces.
Boil with water, onions or mint, and meat for one hour.

notes: Traditional survival recipe

recipes.title: Sea Blite Chicken Soup
recipes.description: A hearty chicken soup featuring foraged sea blite and Parmesan.

instructions.text: Boil chicken in water for 30 minutes.
Remove chicken and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Add all remaining ingredients except cheese to broth.
Simmer 45 minutes.
Return chicken to pot.
Stir in Parmesan cheese before serving.

notes: Sea blite adds natural saltiness - taste before adding salt

recipes.title: Coquina Beach Chowder
recipes.description: A foraged beach chowder using coquina clams and sea purslane.

instructions.text: Boil coquina clams and mole crabs together for broth.
Cook sea purslane separately in plain water to reduce its natural salt.
Combine broth with purslane and some coquina meat.
Warm together and serve.
Add butter and cream if available for richer chowder.

notes: Coquina broth also makes excellent base for creamed potato soup
Can stuff fish with sea purslane or sea rocket

recipes.title: Ramp Soup
recipes.attribution: Foxfire Book of Wild Plant Foods
recipes.source_note: Foxfire Americana Library - Wild Plant Foods
recipes.description: A simple, flavorful soup made with wild ramps.

instructions.text: Sauté ramps in butter until softened.
Add potatoes and broth; simmer until potatoes are tender.
Mash some potatoes against side of pot to thicken.
Stir in cream and season to taste.
Serve hot.

notes: Ramps have a strong garlic-onion flavor
Available only in early spring

recipes.title: Turtle Stew
recipes.source_note: Foxfire Americana Library - Meats and Small Game
recipes.description: Rich, hearty stew from snapping turtle.

instructions.text: Parboil turtle meat 30 minutes; drain.
Brown meat and onion in pot.
Add broth, tomatoes, and bay leaf.
Simmer 1 hour until meat is tender.
Add potatoes; cook 30 minutes more. Season to taste.

notes: Turtle meat has seven distinct textures and flavors

recipes.title: Hog's Head Stew
recipes.source_note: Foxfire Americana Library - Meats and Small Game
recipes.description: Traditional use of hog's head meat in a rich stew.

instructions.text: Cover head with water; simmer until meat falls off bone, about 3 hours.
Remove meat from broth; pick meat from bones.
Return meat to broth; add vegetables and seasonings.
Simmer until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot with cornbread.

notes: Nothing was wasted in traditional hog butchering

recipes.title: Creole Turtle Soup
recipes.attribution: Hank Shaw / Hunter Angler Gardener Cook
recipes.description: Classic New Orleans-style turtle soup with sherry and hard-boiled eggs.

instructions.text: Make a dark roux: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, until it turns the color of milk chocolate (20-30 minutes).
Add onion, celery, and bell pepper. Cook until softened, about 10 minutes.
Add garlic and tomato paste. Cook 2 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes, stock, sherry, Worcestershire, bay leaves, thyme, and cayenne.
Add turtle meat and bring to a simmer.
Simmer gently for 2 hours until turtle is very tender.
Remove bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve in bowls, garnished with chopped hard-boiled eggs, thin lemon slices, and parsley. Pass extra sherry at the table.

notes: A Commander's Palace classic
Pass sherry at the table for diners to add more
Snapping turtle is traditional

recipes.title: Grouse Soup with Wild Rice
recipes.source_note: From honest-food.net - Forest flavors in a bowl
recipes.description: The essence of the forest in a bowl - grouse meat with wild rice, porcini mushrooms, and chestnuts or acorns.

instructions.text: Place grouse carcasses, dried mushrooms, onion, carrots, and celery in a large pot with broth.
Simmer for 1 hour to extract flavor.
Strain broth through a fine strainer lined with paper towel. You need 2-3 quarts.
Chop the rehydrated mushrooms and reserve.
Bring strained broth to a simmer. Add salt and wild rice.
Cook at a slow boil. True wild rice cooks in about 25 minutes; cultivated takes longer.
When rice is nearly done, add grouse meat, chestnuts, mushrooms, and greens.
Simmer 5 minutes more and serve.

notes: For non-hunters: use turkey or chicken thighs, cultivated wild rice, and chestnuts
Real foraged wild rice cooks faster than cultivated
Save grouse carcasses in freezer until you have enough

recipes.title: Southwestern Turkey Leg Stew
recipes.source_note: From honest-food.net - New Mexican stew with chicos
recipes.description: A classic New Mexican stew with dried corn (chicos), chiles, and braised turkey legs. The perfect use for tough wild turkey drumsticks.

instructions.text: Soak chicos or posole in water overnight. Drain.
Toast dried chiles in a dry pan until fragrant. Cover with hot water and soak 20 minutes. Blend smooth.
In a large pot, brown turkey legs on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onion until soft, add garlic, cumin, and oregano.
Add chile puree, stock, corn, and turkey legs.
Simmer until turkey is fall-off-the-bone tender and corn is soft, 2-3 hours.
Remove turkey, shred meat, discard bones and tendons.
Return meat to pot. Season with salt.
Serve with lime, cilantro, and radishes.

notes: Chicos are dried roasted corn used in New Mexican cooking
Can substitute hominy if chicos unavailable
The long cooking time tenderizes even old wild turkey

recipes.title: Wild Turkey Gumbo
recipes.source_note: From honest-food.net - Classic Louisiana gumbo with turkey
recipes.description: One of the great uses for turkey drumsticks - a rich gumbo with andouille sausage and seafood. Uses turkey legs, thighs, and wings.

instructions.text: Simmer turkey in stock until tender, 2-3 hours. Remove turkey, reserve stock. Shred meat when cool.
Make roux: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Whisk in flour.
Cook roux, stirring constantly, until dark chocolate brown, 30-45 minutes.
Add onion, celery, and bell pepper (the 'trinity'). Cook 10 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 1 minute.
Add reserved stock, bay leaves, thyme, and cayenne. Simmer 30 minutes.
Add andouille sausage and cook 15 minutes.
Add okra if using and cook 10 minutes.
Add shredded turkey and shrimp. Cook until shrimp are pink, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in filé powder if using. Top with green onions.
Serve over rice.

notes: Never boil gumbo after adding filé or it becomes stringy
Turkey breast doesn't work well - use dark meat
Can use any smoked sausage if andouille unavailable
